Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Initial Appearance as to Irvin Torres-Figueroa, Miguel Santiago-Jimenez, Raymond Toro-Perez, Josue Justiniano-Mendez, Walberto Rivera-Vigo, Felix Ruiz- Ferrer, Roberto Santiago-Acosta held on 7/9/2010. Defendants were provided with copy of the indictment and advised as to the charges and their rights. At the request of the US Probation Office, due to the number of defendants in these indictments, plus the remoteness of the place where the initials were going to take place, the Court granted waiving the financial affidavits at this time. If needed, and at the request be it from the Government or Probation, the CJA-23 forms will be filled at the time of the arraignments. Defendant #15 - Miguel Santiago-Jimenez will be represented by the FPD's Office, since he appears in two of the three cases, and all the other defendants will be represented by members of the CJA Panel. Arraignment and Detention hearings set for 7/13/2010 at 09:00 AM in Courtroom 11 before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive. Defendants are ordered detained pending hearings. (yr) (Entered: 07/14/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Defendants were provided with copy of the indictment and advised as to the charges and their rights. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Initial Appearance as to Miguel Vargas-Jimenez, Maximino Diodonet-Perez, Miguel Echevarria-Luciano, Norbert Molina-Aviles, Ramon Yace-De Armas, Dennis Sanchez-Rosado, John Doe #1, Giovani Pacheco-Negron, Mariano Muniz-Lopez held on 7/9/2010. Defendants were provided with copy of the indictment and advised as to the charges and their rights. The USPO informed that defendant's 31 true name is Luis Torres-Denizard. At the request of the US Probation Office, due to the number of defendants in these indictments, plus the remoteness of the place where the initials were going to take place, the Court granted waiving the financial affidavits at this time. If needed, and at the request be it from the Government or Probation, the CJA-23 forms  will be filled at the time of the arraignments. US Probation also provided the Court with each defendant's pertinent financial information. Members of the CJA Panel will be appointed to represent each of the defendants. Arraignment and Detention hearings set for 7/15/2010 at 01:30 PM in Courtroom 11 before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive. Defendants are ordered detained pending hearings. (yr) (Entered: 07/14/2010)

Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and enters a PONG as to all cts. of the Indictment. The case is to be referred to Judge Gelpi for trial setting. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Appearing for the Government, Alberto Lopez, for defendants, Anita Hill and PTO, Nancy Mendez. Both defendants are present in Court and are (U/C).Foster Hearing as to Nelson Valentin-Montalvo and Jorge Vazquez-Irizarry held on 8/23/2010. Both defts' are duly sworn in and are admonished by the Magistrate of the possibility of a conflict of interest as a result of the joint representation. Counsel for defendants states that so far she does not foresee a conflict. Both defts' waived their right to be represented by separate counsel. The Court finds that the defendants are acting voluntarily and the joint representation forms are accepted. The forms are to be filed and made part of the record. Defendants were advised that if a conflict should arise, they are to inform the Court and a new counsel will be appointed if they do not have the sources to retain counsel. AS TO BAIL AS TO DEFT. #12. Defense counsel states that as to codefendant #12, Jorge Vazquez-Irizarry, there's no evidence to rebut. The Court states that taking into acct. the statements made by counsel, the pretrial report and the nature of the charges, finds that defendant is a risk of flight and danger to the community and 1s to be detain pending trial. AS TO BAIL AS TO DEFT. #4.Defense counsel is heard as to codefendant #4, Nelson Valentin-Montalvo and a proffer is made. Counsel for the Government, gives a  proffer to the Court and requests that defendant be detain. The Court states that after listening to counsel, reviewing the pretrial report, which the Court adopts makes ruling for the record and orders that defendant be detain pending trial on the basis of risk of flight and danger to the community.b> (Court Reporter FTR.)(Court Interpreter Felix Toledo.)Hearing set for 03:00.Hearing held at 04:04.Hearing ended at 04:32. (mn) (Entered: 08/25/2010)

ORDER denying 807 Motion for Reconsideration as to Nelson Valentin-Montalvo (4): Nothing in the motion for reconsideration overcomes the findings made by the court in  its detention order. (See Docket No. 601 at p.2). Moreover, defendant #4, unlike defendants #11 and #16, has been charged with a violation to Title 18, United States Code, Section 924(0). Although defendants #4, #11 and #16 have all been charged as suppliers, only as to defendant #4 does the indictment allege that "he would possess and carry firearms in furtherance of the drug trafficking activities." (Docket No. 3 at p.16). In addition, according to the Pretrial Services Report, defendant Nelson Valentin Montalvo failed to report to an appointment with the pretrial division of the Superior Court of Mayaguez. The court's decision to adopt the findings and recommendation of the Pretrial Service Report is reaffirmed. Signed by US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez on 10/29/10. (Lopez, Marcos) (Entered: 10/29/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Appearing for the Government, Alberto Lopez, for defendant, Ernesto Reyes-Blassino and PO, Shakira Botello.Bail Revocation Hearing as to Anthony Ramos-Martinez held on 11/29/2010. Defense counsel states that defendant's TN: Anthony Ramos-Montanez. Defense counsel states to the Court that defendant, volunteer and appeared today in Court. He states that his grandmother who's the third party custodian did not come as her coming to the Court affects her. He gives the Court a proffer. The Court makes questions to defense counsel. Counsel for the Government is heard and states that there are conditions to revoke bail as he stayed out of the house four (4) times. PO, Shakira Botello is heard. The Court after making inquires orders that defendant be placed in a Halfway House. Defendant is to comply with the conditions of the halfway house in addition to the conditions that the Court had previously imposed, including, mental health and drug testing. The Court further states that it is giving the deft. an opportunity to be out of MDC, but if he fails, the Court will have no choice but to place him at MDC. (Court Reporter FTR.)(Court Interpreter Hilda Gutierrez.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 02:07.Hearing ended at 02:18. (mn) (Entered: 11/29/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Bond Revocation Hearing as to Leonardo M. Ruiz-Ortiz held on 3/31/2011. Present were SAUSA Alberto Lopez-Rocafort, Mr. Ramon L. Garay and PO Santana. Mr. Garay stated that defendant had filed a motion for change of plea and requesting that he be allowed to surrender so that the time can start counting. SAUSA Lopez asked that since defendant was not contesting the allegations contained in the motion, that his bail be revoked. Mr. Garay stated that they might have evidence to contest the motion, but since defendant wanted to voluntarily surrender, the motion was now moot. The Court ruled that the bail previously imposed was now revoked and defendant was ordered detained without bail. (Court Reporter -FTR.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 10:00.Hearing ended at 10:06.Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (yr) (Entered: 04/05/2011)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Appearing for the Government, Sean Torriente, for deft., Carlos Vazquez & PO, Shakira Botello-Sanchez. Deft. is present in Court and is (O/B).Bail Revocation Hearing as to Sammy Pitre-Colon held on 4/7/2011. Defense counsel states that he will not contests the allegations in the motion filed by PO and is ready to surrender. The Court advises the deft. of his right to waive the bail revocation hearing and thereafter deft. says that he wants to have the hearing. Testimony on behalf of the Government, by Shakira Botello- Sanchez is heard. Cross examination is also held. The Court after hearing the parties makes ruling for the record and states that the violations have been had and deft. has failed to comply with them, and the bail is revoked and deft. shall remain detain at MDC. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Arraignment/Detention as to Josue Pacheco-Negron (28) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 6/6/2011. Present were AUSA Mariana Bauza, Ms. Nereida Melendez and PTO Omayra Hernandez. Defendant was found competent at this time to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. Case is referred to Judge Gelpi for trial scheduling. As to bail, Ms. Melendez stated that at this time they had nothing to offer as to bail, but requested that the Government be ordered to produce all records as to defendant's detention and transfer to this district, since defendant had been detained since last December and had not been brought before the Court until last week. The Court granted the request and ordered the Government to produce said records. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail. Order to issue. (Court Reporter -FTR (Courtroom 8).)Hearing set for 09:30.Hearing held at 10:07.Hearing ended at 10:16.Interpreter Hilda Gutierrez. (yr) (Entered: 06/06/2011)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Arraignment/Detention as to Hector Luciano-Bracero (49) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 6/6/2011. Present were AUSA Mariana Bauza, Ms. Linda Backiel and PTO Omayra Hernandez. Defendant was found competent at this time to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts conditioned to their right to file motions as to whether this Court had jurisdiction over defendant. Case is referred to Judge Gelpi for trial scheduling. As to bail, Ms. Backiel joined the request made by Ms. Melendez in relation to defendant #28, and specifically requested the production of both the USM records as to the detention and transfer as well as those of BOP, as her client had also been detained at MDC since last December and had not been brought before the Court until last week. The Court granted the request and ordered the Government to produce said records. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail. Order to issue. (Court Reporter -FTR (Courtroom 8).)Hearing set for 09:30.Hearing held at 10:07.Hearing ended at 10:16.Interpreter Hilda Gutierrez. (yr) (Entered: 06/06/2011)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Arraignment/Detention as to Damaris Nieves-Morales (62) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 6/6/2011. Present were AUSA Mariana Bauza, Mr. Saul Roman and PTO Omayra Hernandez. Defendant was found competent at this time to understand the proceedings. She waived the reading of the indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. Case is referred to Judge Gelpi for trial scheduling. As to bail, Mr. Roman stated that at this time they had nothing to offer as to bail, and joined the request for records  made by the attorneys for defendants #28 and 49, as to the production of all records related to defendant's detention and transfer to this district as his client was in the same circumstances as to the other two. The Court granted the request and ordered the Government to produce said records. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail. Order to issue. (Court Reporter -FTR (Courtroom 8).)Hearing set for 09:30.Hearing held at 10:07.Hearing ended at 10:16.Interpreter Hilda Gutierrez. (yr) (Entered: 06/06/2011)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin:Change of Plea Hearing as to Jose L. Gomez-Garcia (56) was held on 3/13/2012. Present: AUSA Olga Castellon, Atty Ramon Gonzalez, Interpreter Hilda Guitierrez and Defendant. Consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. The defendant is found competent to plea. The defendant is advised of the maximum penalties he is facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving his constitutional rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to Gustavo A. Gelpi, U.S. District Judge so that the guilty plea as to count 1 of the Indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Sentencing Hearing to be set by Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi. Defendant to remain detained. (E-mail to USPO) (Court Reporter FTR.) (Hearing was set for 9:00 a.m., held at 9:48-10:15 a.m.) (mc) (Entered: 03/23/2012)

AUSA Michael Bagge and defense counsel Frank Inserni were present. Defendant was present in court and on bond. Consent was approved, filed and made part of the record. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Change of Plea Hearing as to Roberto Roman-Orench was called but not held on 4/10/2012. AUSA Olga Castellon and defense counsel Luis R. Rivera-Rodriguez were present. Defense counsel informed that, after having met with his client and the government, defendant did not reach an agreement and will exercise his right to go trial. Defendant expressed that the Court granted that some compact disks, as part of discovery provided to former retained counsel Rafael Castro-Lang, be returned to defendant. Defendant stated that the Cds were delivered to his wife and had no recordings. Counsel Rivera will verify with counsel Castro-Lang and, if they are faulty copies, will request the government to produce another set. The Court ordered that the issue of discovery be solved prior to the next conference before the Judge, the change of plea motion, DE 2717 , is withdrawn and that the case be sent back to Judge Gelpi for further proceedings and/or trial date. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 03:00. Hearing held at 03:58. Hearing ended at 04:04. Interpreter Felix Toledo. (br) (Entered: 04/10/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Bond Revocation Hearing as to Julio Barbot-Marquez held on 8/9/2012. Present were AUSA Olga Castellon and Mr. Peter Berkowitz, as well as PO J. Santana. The Government argues the facts of the motion filed by Probation and requests that his bail be revoked since defendant already pled guilty and is waiting for sentencing hearing. Mr. Berkowitza argues against revocation of bail and explains to the Court the possible causes of defendant's behavior for law 54 violations due to adjustment as to his medications, and requests that defendant be allowed to enter an inpatient mental health program. The Court inquired from PO Santana as to the motion filed. After hearing the arguments from the parties, the Court held its decision in abeyance until after August 22, date on which preliminary hearing for the state charges 1s scheduled, and requested the parties to file a motion informing the result of the same. Defendant will remain under custody. (Court Reporter -FTR.)Hearing set for 01:00.Hearing held at 02:07.Hearing ended at 02:19. Interpreter -Hilda Gutierrez. (yr) (Entered: 08/09/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Change of Plea Hearing as to Jose G. Rivera-Ibarrondo (30) was held on 8/10/2012. Present: AUSA Olga Castellon, Atty Sonia Torres, Interpreter Mary Jo Smith and Defendant. Consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted  in open court. The deft is found competent to plea. The deft is advised of the maximum penalties he is facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving his constitutional rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to Gustavo A. Gelpi, U.S. District Judge so that the guilty plea as to Count Count 1 of the Indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Sentencing Hearing to be set by Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi. Deft to remain detained pending sentencing. Defense counsel informed the court that deft has been complaining about abdominal pain and that he has not been provided medical attention. The court is ordering MDC to file a sealed informative motion as to deft's medical history at MDC by no later than 8/20/2012. (E-mail to USPO) (Court Reporter FTR) (Hearing was set for 2:30 p.m., held at 2:47-3:13 p.m.) (mc) (Entered: 08/20/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Appearing for the Government, Olga Castellon and for defendants Luis Rivera. Foster Hearing as to Roberto Roman-Orench (2), Javier Torres-Rivera (13) held on 10/3/2012. Defense counsel informed the Court that defendant Roman-Orench (2) does not want to continue with his legal representation and he rejected the plea offer made by the government. Plea offer was withdrawn. The Court denied without prejudice the issue of legal representation. The matter of the COP is moot and the issue of the withdrawal of attorney will be addressed at the Pretrial Conference to be held before Judge Gelpi. As to defendant Javier Torres-Rivera (13), he was advised as to any possible conflict that may arise in the future of having been represented by the same attorney. After having been admonished by the Court, the defendant agreed to be represented by counsel. Acknowledgment of Joint Representation Admonishment was signed by defendant and counsel. The same was approved by the Court. The Court found no probable conflict of interest at this time. (Court Reporter FTR.) Hearing held at 05:53.Hearing ended at 06:27.Interpreter Annie Flores. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Change of Plea Hearing as to Miguel Vargas-Jimenez (9) was held on 10/4/2012. Present: AUSA Olga Castellon, Atty Robert Odasz, Interpreter Heidi Cazes and Defendant. Consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. The defendant is found competent to plea. The defendant is advised of the maximum penalties he is facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving his constitutional rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to Gustavo A. Gelpi, U.S. District Judge so that the guilty plea as to Count 1 of the Indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Sentencing is set for 2/4/2013 at 9:00 AM before Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi. Defendant to remain under the same conditions of release. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi:Sentencing held on 6/10/2014 for Miguel Vargas-Jimenez (9). Present were Olga Castellon and Atty Robert Odasz. Defendant was present O/B and assisted by the official court interpreter. No objections to PSR. Defendants allocution heard, requested voluntary surrender. Defense atty provided explanation as to defendants request due to medical condition. Arguments were heard from the Government objecting to allow defendants voluntary surrender. Defense counsel arguments heard. After hearing the parties, the Court found that no medical records or evidence were presented as proof of medical condition allegation, therefore, defendant was ordered to surrender today 6/10/2014 at 2:00pm to the US Marshal Service Office in Hato Rey. Order to issue to MDC for defendants immediate medical evaluation. Count 1, Term of Imprisonment-70 months; SRT-8 years; SMA-$100.00; Counts 2, 3, 4, 5, Dismissed. Defendant was advised as to his right to appeal. (USPO Manuel Casanova)(Court Reporter Evilys Carrion.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 10:38.Hearing ended at 11:05.Interpreter Marie Hernandez. (al) (Entered: 06/10/2014)

Defense counsel informed that they are contesting the allegations and that there is a pending preliminary hearing on state court set for 6/25/2014 in relation to this case. ORDER: Denied 4254 Motion to Reduce Sentence - USSC Amendment 782 as to Luis Rivera-Ibarrondo (19). The court, in the exercise of its discretion, opts not reduce defendant's sentence of 126 months to the minimum of 120 months. Defendant possessed and carried firearms and would also provide the same to DTO members. He also collected proceeds of drug sales and paid street sellers, as admitted in the plea agreement's statement of facts (Docket No. 3420 ). Accordingly, he is not deserving of any sentence reduction. He has benefitted sufficiently by virtue of his plea agreement. Signed by Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi (GDM) (Entered: 11/06/2014)

ORDER: Denied 4255 Motion to Reduce Sentence - USSC Amendment 782 as to Bryan Pacheco-Negron (38). The court, in the exercise of its discretion, opts not to reduce defendant's sentence of 87 months. The court notes that this defendant possessed firearms in furtherance of the conspiracy (PSR at parr 67 -Docket No. 1457 ). In addition, this is not the first time this young man has serious encounters with the law. He previously was convicted and jailed for a state drug crime and sentenced to do time (PSR at parr 95). He also pled guilty to attempted murder at the state level. He already received reduced sentence by way of his plea agreement; otherwise, he was facing mandatory minimum of ten years (120 months). Signed by Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi (GDM) (Entered: 11/06/2014)

Gelpi (GDM) (Entered: 11/12/2014)

ORDER: Denying 4270 Motion to Reduce Sentence - USSC Amendment 782 as to Francisco Gordils-Torres (32). The court, in the exercise of its discretion hereby opt not to reduce defendant's sentence by virtue of Amendment 782. This defendant already obtained a below mandatory minimum sentence as a result of his plea agreement. In addition, as stipulated in his plea statement of facts (Docket No. 2835 ), he acted as a manager and seller of different types of narcotics for the drug trafficking organization. He also collected the proceeds of drug sales and paid the street sellers. Signed by Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi (MET) (Entered: 11/12/2014)

ORDER: Denied 4265 Motion to Reduce Sentence - USSC Amendment 782 as to Alberto Herrera-Perez (5). The court, in the exercise of its discretion, hereby DENIES defendant's motion to reduce sentence as per Amendment 782. The defendant here acted as a cocaine supplier, who also converted the same to crack cocaine. He would then deliver the drugs for further distribution at the drug points (See Plea Agreement statement of facts at Docket No. 3414 ). This defendant also obtained a reduced sentence by virtue of his Plea Agreement, to wit, two years below the 120 mandatory minimum. Signed by Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi (GDM) (Entered: 11/12/2014)

ORDER: Denied 4267 Motion to Reduce Sentence - USSC Amendment 782 as to Hector Blanco-Justiniano (10). The court, in the excersise of its discretion, hereby DENIES defendant's motion to reduce sentence as per Amendment 782. As stipulated in the Plea Agreement (Docket No. 2658 at pp. 11-12). Defendant acted as a supplier for the Drug Trafficking Organization, delivering wholesale amounts of heroin and cocaine for further distribution at drug points. By virtue of his Plea Agreement defendant received a sentence below the 10 year mandatory minimum. Signed by Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi (GDM) (Entered: 11/12/2014)

ORDER REGARDING SENTENCE - USSC Amendment 782 as to Nelson Valentin- Montalvo (4), DK T# 4319 Denied. The Court in the exercise of its discretion denies the sentence reduction pursuant to amendment 782. In particular, defendant's involvement in the conspiracy included use and distribution to others of firearms to other members. This outweighs the considerations adduced by him in his memorandum (dkt 4360). (manual notification sent to deft)Signed by Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi on 2/27/15.(al) (Entered: 02/27/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin:Arraignment/Bail as to Edwin Lorenzo-Nieves (84) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6 held on 5/21/2015. Present were AUSA Seth Erbe and Ms Lara Castro. Dft was present and under custody. Defendant was found competent at this time to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Gelpi for scheduling. As to bail, Ms Castro informed that they were not requesting bail at this time. The Government moved for detention. The Court granted the Government's motion and ordered defendant detained without bail. Order to issue. Sidebar requested by the parties. (Court Reporter - FTR.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 10:10.Hearing ended at 10:15.Interpreter - Mary Jo Smith. (yr) (Entered: 05/22/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to David Cruz-Ibarrondo (72) held on 5/26/2015. Present: SAUSA Glenn Goetchius, AFPD Yasmin Irizarry and PO Ricardo Cruz. The government withdrew the standard condition #6 regarding notification to the USPO of any change of residence. Matter was deemed moot in light of the withdrawal. Waiver of preliminary hearing was filed. The Court after advising the defendant as to his rights, approved the waiver and found probable cause only as to the standard condition #2 that defendant shall answer truthfully all inquiries to the USPO. Case referred to Judge Gelpi  for Final Revocation Hearing. Defense counsel requested that defendant continue under supervision in the free community until the final revocation hearing is held. The government had no objection. The Court set conditions of release, aside from the standard conditions, defendant shall have a curfew from 7:00 pm to 6:00 am with an EMD. (Court Reporter FTR.)Hearing set for 10:15.Hearing held at 10:54.Hearing ended at 11:03.Interpreter Felix Toledo. (ft) (Entered: 05/28/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi:Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to David Cruz-Ibarrondo (72) held on 6/9/2015. Present were Olga Castellon and AFPD Leonardo Aldrige. Deft was present O/B assisted by the court interpreter. After hearing the parties the Court did not revoked SRT. Conditions were modified as follows: Defendant shall served 3 months home detention starting today, afterwards, USPO shall inform the Court if period shall be extended or removed. Defendant shall remain with EMD. Defendant shall be allowed to work, fish and attend matters only with the prior authorization of the USPO. Defendant shall notify USPO any change of address. Defendant shall be provided Moral Reconation Therapy, USPO to coordinate location as of this treatment. (USPO Ricardo Cruz)(Court Reporter Evilys Carrion. )Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 10:22.Hearing ended at 10:26.Interpreter Carlos Lao. (al) (Entered: 06/10/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Josue Justiniano-Mendez (53) held on 1/21/2016. Present were AUSA Cesar Rivera, defense counsel Yassmin Irizarry and USPO Miriam Morales. The defendant was U/C, present in court and assisted by the Court Interpreter. The alleged violations of conditions in the motion filed by USPO Morales at docket 4649 were discussed. Parties agreed that the defendant had complied with said conditions with the exception of the pending accusation at state level. Defense counsel argued in favor of bail. The Government and USPO did not oppose. After hearing the parties, the Court imposed the following conditions of release pending the resolution of the state charges: bail was set in the amount of $5,000.00 unsecured with defendant's signature, drug testing and curfew to be established by the supervising officer. The defendant shall continue or seek employment and all other standard conditions of release were also imposed. The Court scheduled a Further Preliminary Revocation Hearing to take place after the hearing at state level is held. Further Preliminary Revocation Hearing is set for 2/22/2016 at 9:15 AM in Courtroom 8 before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll. (Court Reporter DCR.) Hearing set for 11:00  am. Hearing held at 11:51 am. Hearing ended at 11:59 am. Interpreter Felix Toledo. (cmd) (Entered: 01/21/2016)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Wesley Vargas-Derioux (60) held on 2/7/2017. Present were AUSA Nicholas Cannon, AFPD Victor Gonzalez and USPO Ricardo Cruz-Sanabria. The defendant was under custody, present in court and assisted by the Court Interpreter. Defense counsel admitted that violations of conditions #3 and #7 were committed as stated in the motion filed by USPO Cruz at docket 4962 . The Court found probable cause as to said conditions and referred the case to U.S. District Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi for the Final Revocation Hearing. As to bail, the defense counsel moved for release and requested substance abuse treatment. The Government did not oppose. After hearing the parties, the Court imposed the following conditions of release in addition to those previously imposed, pending the final revocation hearing: the defendant shall submit to a substance abuse evaluation and treatment as deemed necessary by USPO and wear an electronic monitoring device. The defendant must work and make child support payments. (Court Reporter DCR.) Hearing set for 2:00 pm. Hearing held at 2:06 pm. Hearing ended at 2:12 pm. Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. (cmd) (Entered: 02/07/2017)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Joshua Rodriguez-Mantilla (48) held on 3/1/2017. Present: AUSA Victor Acevedo, AFPD Jessica Earl. Defendant did not contest the standard condition no. 2 that defendant failed to call the random drug testing system. The standard condition no. 7, testing positive to drug test was withdrawn by the USPO. Testimony of USPO Ricardo Cruz was heard on behalf of the government. Cross- examination conducted. Re-direct. After hearing the testimony of the witness, the Court found probable cause as to all of the allegations contained in the motions filed by Probation with the exception of the illegal use of Oxycodone on 12/7/16 and 1/23/17  which were withdrawn by the USPO. Matter was referred to Judge Gelpi for final revocation hearing. As to detention, the government moved for detention. Defense counsel requested that defendant remain under supervised release conditions pending final revocation hearing. Counsel shall file a motion with some alternatives for the court's consideration of placing the defendant under stricter conditions of release pending final revocation hearing. (Court Reporter DCR.)Hearing set for 09:15.Hearing held at 10:33.Hearing ended at 11:09.Interpreter Annie Flores. (ft) (Entered: 03/08/2017)

Minute for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Richard Pacheco-Negron (51) held on 3/27/2017. Present: AUSA Edward Veronda, AFPD Vivian Torralbas, USPO Ricardo Cruz. Defendant was U/C, present in court and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Counsel for defendant informed that they are waiving the hearing. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing was filed. The Court approved the same and made a finding of probable cause. Case is referred to Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi for setting of Final Revocation Hearing. The government moved for detention pending final revocation hearing. Defense counsel stated that at this time they had nothing to offer, but reserved the right to reopen the matter. The Court granted government's motion and ordered defendant detained. Defendant's 5018 Motion for Disclosure was granted. AFPD Torralbas requested that the docket be amended to reflect the correct date of defendant's arrest. The Court instructed defense counsel to file a motion before the presiding judge. (Court Reporter DCR.)(Court Interpreter Edna Brayfield.)Hearing set for 11:00.Hearing held at 11:13.Hearing ended at 11:16. (dv) (Entered: 03/27/2017)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Alex Velez-Laguna (29) held on 12/14/2017. Present were AUSA Seth Erbe, AFPD Samantha Drake and USPO Ricardo Cruz. The defendant was under custody, present in court and assisted by the Court Interpreter. Defendant filed a Waiver of Preliminary Hearing. The Court approved the waiver and found probable cause pursuant to Rule 5 and 32.1 of the F.R.Cr.P.. The case is referred to Gustavo A. Gelpi, U.S. District Judge for the Final Revocation Hearing. As to bail, defense counsel argued in favor of release pending the final revocation hearing. The Government did not oppose but requested that the defendant's father be qualified as TPC prior to his release. USPO Cruz recommended a mental health evaluation and treatment for anger management be included as part of the conditions of release. After listening to the parties, the Court granted the Government's request. In addition to the conditions of supervised release already imposed, the defendant shall submit himself to a mental health evaluation and treatment as deemed necessary. Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release is set for 1/17/2018 at 9:00 AM in Old San Juan Courtroom before Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi. (Court Reporter DCR.) Hearing set for 2:00 pm. Hearing held at 2:55 pm. Hearing ended at 3:02 pm. Interpreter Olga Uribe. (cmd) (Entered: 12/15/2017)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Mariano Muniz-Lopez (45) held on 1/23/2018. Present AUSA G. Massucco, AFPD Jessica Earl, PO Ricardo Cruz. Defendant was present in court, under custody and assisted by court interpreter. Testimony of PRPD Roger Bermudez was heard on behalf of the government. Cross-examination conducted. After hearing the testimony of the witness, the Court found probable cause with the clarification that the court did not make any finding that defendant punch the victim in the face. The matter was referred to Judge Gelpi for final revocation hearing. Gov's Exhs 1,2 and 3 were admitted. The government was granted one week to submit English translation of Exhibit 3. Defense counsel requested that defendant be release pending final revocation hearing. The government leave it to the discretion of the court. The court adopted in full all of the conditions of supervised release imposed by Judge Gelpi, but added some additional conditions as follows: EMD with home detention, defendant is allowed to work, defendant is not allowed to reside or have any contact at all, in person or otherwise, with Cristina Flores-Walsh plus anger management counseling. (Court Reporter DCR.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held from 1:33 to 1:36 and from 1:47 to 3:00.Gov's Interpreter Jose Irizarry. (ft) (Entered: 01/26/2018)

ORDER Setting Conditions of Release (Revocation of Supervised Release) as to Mariano Muniz-Lopez (45). Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Mariano Muniz-Lopez (45) held on 10/29/2018. Present were AUSA Nadia Pineda, AFPD Yassmin Irizarry and USPO Ricardo Cruz. The defendant was under custody, present in court and assisted by the Court Interpreter. Testimony of USPO Ricardo Cruz was heard on behalf of the Government. Direct and Cross-examination conducted. Government's Exhibit 1 was presented and admitted. The Government has 5 days to produce Certified Translations of Exhibit #1. After hearing, the testimony of the witness, the Court found probable cause as to the allegations contained in the motion filed at ECF No. 5350. As to the allegations contained in the motion filed at ECF NO. 5226 , the Court holds the ruling under advisement. The parties have 5 days to file a motion and brief the Court on a legal issue in which the finding of probable cause to the violation of Standard Condition #1 hinges. The case is referred to Gustavo A. Gelpi, U.S. District Judge for the Final Revocation Hearing. (Court Reporter DCR / Courtroom 8.)Hearing set for 02:00. Hearing held at 02:39. Hearing ended at 03:34. Interpreter Olga Uribe. (ram) (Entered: 11/05/2018)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Pedro A. Delgado-Hernandez:Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Felix Ruiz-Ortiz (81) held on 8/23/2019. Present: AUSA Juan Reyes, AFPD Jessica Earl and USPO Narvaez. The defendant was present in court, U/C and assisted by the Court Interpreter. Defendant does not contest the allegations. Statements by defense counsel in support of mitigation of punishment were heard on behalf of defendant. Defendant's allocution heard. Government's position also heard. After having heard the parties, the Court found that defendant violated the conditions of supervised release. Therefore, supervised release term was REVOKED. Sentence imposed- IMPR: Ten (10) months to be served consecutively to the term of imprisonment imposed in 17-cr-600-01(PAD) for a total of Sixty-Two (62) Months; SRT: Four (4) Months to be served concurrently with the term of imprisonment imposed in 17-cr-600-01(PAD). Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Hancel Marrero-Ramirez (54) held on 9/3/2019. Present were AUSA Jeanette Collazo, AFPD Vivian Marrero and USPO Ricardo Cruz. The defendant was under custody, present in court and assisted by the Court Interpreter. The defendant filed a Waiver of Preliminary Hearing. The Court approved the waiver and found probable cause as to the charges contained in the motion filed by USPO Mendoza at dockets 4688 . The case is referred to the presiding judge for a Final Revocation Hearing. As to bail, AFPD Marrero moved for the imposition of conditions of release pending the final revocation hearing. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan:Preliminary Revocation Hearing re 5310 Motion Notifying SRT Violations as to Alex Velez-Laguna (29) held on 9/4/2019. Present: AUSA Jose Contreras (for Alberto Lopez), AFPD Yasmin Irizarry and USPO Ricardo Cruz. The defendant was present, under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. The defendant submitted a Waiver of Preliminary Hearing form but later withdrew it. The parties were granted a recess to prepare for the hearing. Case was recalled at 11:08 AM. The defendant accepted the new criminal conduct allegation only as to the charge that he was convicted of in state court, which was a violation of Article 3.1 of the PR Domestic Violence Law 54. However, the defense contested the allegations regarding violations of Articles 3.2 and 3.3. The remaining allegations included in Docket 5310 were uncontested. The testimony of USPO Cruz was heard. The parties argued as to the issue of probable cause. After having heard the witness's testimony and the parties' arguments, the Court found probable cause as to new criminal conduct regarding violation of Article 3.2 of the Domestic Violence Law. Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release set for 12/3/2019 09:00 AM in Old San Juan Courtroom before Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi. (Court Reporter DCR-Courtroom 6.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing  held at 10:12.Hearing ended at 11:45.Interpreter Felix Toledo. (lod) (Entered: 09/13/2019)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Initial Appearance re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Norbert Molina-Aviles (23) held on 7/1/2020 via VTC. AUSA Enrique Silva and AFPD Eleonora Marranzini were present via VTC. Defendant was under custody, present via VTC and assisted by the certified court interpreter. Defendant consented to hold the hearing via VTC. He was advised of the SRT violations and his right to a preliminary hearing to determine whether his supervised release conditions have been violated or not. The Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. The Federal Public Defender was appointed to represent the defendant. The Court ordered the defendant temporarily detained. A Preliminary Revocation Hearing is set for 7/15/2020 at 02:00 PM via MEL's VTC Bridge before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. Jencks / Rule 26.2 material must be produced to defense counsel at least one hour in advance of the hearing. If the government intends to call a witness that is not fluent in the English language, failure of the government to timely retain the services of an interpreter may result in the imposition of sanctions. Court Reporter Amy Walker present via VTC. Hearing set for 11:00. Hearing held at 11:03. Hearing ended at 11:20. Interpreter Carlos Ravelo present via VTC. (jr) (Entered: 07/01/2020)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Initial Appearance on Revocation of Supervised Release as to Bryan Pacheco-Negron (38) held on 10/15/2020. AUSA Jeanette Collazo and AFPD Coral Rodriguez were present. Defendant was under custody, present in court and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. Defendant voluntarily consented to the holding of the hearing via VTC. Defendant was advised of the SRT violations and his right to a preliminary hearing to determine whether his supervised release conditions have been violated or not. The Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. The Federal Public Defender was appointed to represent the defendant. The Court ordered the defendant temporarily detained. A Preliminary Revocation Hearing is set for 10/30/2020 at 09:00 AM via MEL's VTC Bridge before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. To avoid unnecessary delays, at least one hour before the hearing the government shall make available to the defense Jencks / FRCr.P 26.2 material. If the government intends to call a witness that is not fluent in the English language, failure of the government to timely retain the services of an interpreter may result in the imposition of sanctions. (Court Reporter Cindy Brown.) Hearing set
00. Hearing held at 01:07. Hearing ended at 01:18. Interpreter Felix Toledo. (jjr) (Entered: 10/16/2020)

ORDER granting 5717 Motion to Vacate as to Luis Borrero-Mejias (94): After reviewing the case docket in preparation for the preliminary revocation hearing set for 12/14/2020, the Court noticed that because this defendant is currently under conditions of supervised release, he is not entitled to a preliminary hearing based on the Motion Notifying Violations of Supervision Conditions. Today, the parties filed a joint motion requesting that the hearing be vacated on the same grounds. Therefore, the Court hereby GRANTS the parties' request to vacate the preliminary hearing and refers the matter to U.S. District Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi for final revocation hearing. The defendant shall remain under the same conditions of release pending further proceedings. As to the defense's motion for disclosure, the Court GRANTS the request and orders the USPO to produce all evidence directly related to the alleged SRT violations as well as any evidence that will be used by the Government at the final hearing. Should that evidence include any chronos, the USPO is ordered to produce only those chronos related to the alleged violations, including notes that may exculpate the defendant's conduct, after the same have been redacted to protect or conceal information regarding third parties, or any information that may compromise the personal safety of any individual. Preliminary Revocation Hearing set for 12/14/2020 is VACATED. Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release set for 3/11/2021 09:00 AM in Old San Juan Courtroom before Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi. Signed by US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan on 12/11/2020. (lod) (Entered: 12/11/2020)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez:Initial Appearance on Revocation of Supervised Release as to Gilbert Vargas-Dereiux (44) held on 4/14/2021. AUSA Victor Acevedo and AFPD Victor Gonzalez were present. Defendant was under custody, present and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. Defendant voluntarily consented to the holding of the hearing via VTC. Defendant was advised of the alleged SRT violations filed at ECF No. 5756 and his right to a preliminary hearing to determine whether his supervised release  conditions have been violated. The Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. CJA Counsel Jose B. Velez-Goveo was assigned to represent the defendant. Defendant was ordered temporarily detained. A preliminary revocation hearing was set for 4/28/2021 at 2:30 PM via VTC before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. If the government intends to call a witness that is not fluent in the English language, failure of the government to timely retain the services of an interpreter may result in the imposition of sanctions. Pursuant to the Due Process Protections Act, Pub. L. No. 116-182, 134 Stat. 894 (Oct. 21, 2020) and Rule 5(f) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure, the United States is reminded of its obligation to disclose in a timely manner all exculpatory evidence to the defendant[s], that is, all evidence that is favorable to the defendant[s] or tends to cast doubt on the United States case, as required by Brady v. Maryland, 373 U.S. 83 (1963) and its progeny. Failure to comply with this order may result in consequences, including, but not limited to, the exclusion of evidence, dismissal of the revocation proceedings regarding the alleged supervised release violations, contempt proceedings, disciplinary action, and/or sanctions by the Court. (Court Reporter DCR/ ZoomGov Recording.)Hearing set for 02:00. Hearing held at 02:37. Hearing ended at 02:42. Interpreter Sonia Cresciont. (mig) (Entered: 04/16/2021)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Initial appearance re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Nelson Morales-Saldivia (1) held on 5/18/2021. AUSA Jawayria Auchter, AFPD Jessica Earl and USPO Linda Perez were present. Defendant was under custody, present and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. Defendant voluntarily consented to the holding of the hearing via VTC. Defendant was advised of the alleged SRT violations  filed at ECF No. 5766 and his right to a preliminary hearing to determine whether his supervised release conditions have been violated. The Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. The FPD was appointed to represent the defendant. Defense counsel argued for conditions of release. The government argued for detention. Defendant was ordered detained pending the preliminary revocation hearing. Defendant may raise further arguments for conditions of release at the preliminary revocation hearing. A preliminary revocation hearing was set for 5/26/2021 at 11:00 am via VTC before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez.
